content.rendered:
Celebrate Hispanic Cultural Heritage

In the United States, Hispanic Heritage Month (September 15 to October 15) celebrates the histories, cultures and contributions of Hispanic Americans whose ancestors came from Spain, Mexico, the Caribbean and Central and South America. Each year during Hispanic Heritage Month, the Hispanic Sociaty presents an exciting slate of programming to honor the cultural legacies of Hispanic communities here in the United States and across the world. From film screenings and concerts to our much-loved Day of the Dead celebrations, there is something for everyone.

Please visit our Events Calendar to see our full schedule of programs and to RSVP.
